messages.title: Fairness - time to really tackle inequality
messages.content: Green Party candidate Natalie Bennett asks how we plan to address the growing inequality in our society.

messages.title: Green Party: fair is worth fighting for

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green candidates favor a plan where empty properties are refurbished for council housing to solve the homes crisis.
Green Party proposes a London 'living wage' of at least £7.60/hour.
Calls for a maximum 10:1 pay ratio in the public sector, to reduce the income gap.

issues.socialWelfare: Aims to ensure that 'every child matters' with a fair start in life, including a fair living wage for all and affordable local services.

housing.content: Green candidates favor a plan where empty properties are refurbished for council housing to solve the homes crisis.

politicalExperience.role: Lead Green Party candidate for Camden

images.caption: Natalie Bennett standing in front of a housing block.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is printed on recycled paper using environmentally friendly inks. Please recycle it after you've read it.
